title: (Senior) Engineering Manager - Hardware (all genders)
content:
Who We Are
For over 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the forefront of sonic innovation. Guided by our mission to inspire and enable creators to express themselves, we develop integrated audio hardware and software solutions for musicians, producers, engineers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience.
Our Hardware Systems team works across the full music production and DJ product portfolio and the new and exciting features that will bring our hardware systems to the next level. From UX and industrial design, mechanical engineering, electronics engineering, embedded software development, HW-QA to packaging - this team is responsible for maintaining and pushing the boundaries of the development of high-quality systems.
We are looking for a (Senior) Engineering Manager (all genders) to support our Berlin-based hardware systems development team with manufacturing in China. In this role you will build teams that are creating the next generation of music production and DJ systems and you will lead them through the entire development process to production start. In this position you lead and work in a multidisciplinary Development Team in close collaboration with the products organisation. You will work from our office in Berlin, Kreuzberg in a multicultural and creative environment.
 
What You'll Do
Lead a team of Hardware Engineers working on the innovation, development, and sustaining of Hardware Systems.
Work closely with your team, other Engineering Managers, Product Managers,  Project Managers, Program Manager as well with other stakeholders to develop and deliver against technology and product roadmaps.
Promote best practices in the development of Hardware solutions.
Mentor and guide the professional and technical maturity of your team in a healthy and sustainable way.
Organise a continuous feedback process, including annual reviews and professional development process for the engineers.
Monitor individual workloads ensuring sustainability and the employees' well-being.
Monitoring and managing conflicts which cannot be solved by the teams themselves.
Help plan and form teams that are collaborative, inclusive and respectful.
Work with our recruiting team to attract, onboard and retain engineers from diverse backgrounds 
 
What You’ll Need
You are an experienced people manager and have led, coached and mentored Hardware Engineers,
You have an advanced degree (e.g, master’s degree, diploma, or comparable) in Engineering and long-term engineering expertise in Hardware development (Mechanical, Electronics or Embedded Software preferred),
Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum preferred),
You offer demonstrated skills in facilitation and communication, you love to collaborate and empower others,
You have profound knowledge of relevant technology and processes, keeping up with new standards, technologies, and tools,
You are capable of analysing, structuring and documenting best practices,
You are comfortable and effective in managing multiple assignments,
You are comfortable working in a complex environment and you are familiar with managing risks and uncertainties,
You bring excellent English written and verbal communication skills, combined with a solution-oriented way of working, German is a plus.
 
About Us
Native Instruments embraces diversity and a respect for all people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Native Instruments we value teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.
All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

demographic_questions.header: Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging, and Accessibility
demographic_questions.description:
At NI, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace that values all individuals' unique perspectives and contributions. To further this commitment, we have implemented a policy to ensure that candidates from underrepresented groups, including those related to gender, disability, ethnicity, and sexuality, have equitable opportunities in our hiring process.

If you identify with one or more of these underrepresented groups, please inform us by selecting the appropriate category during the application process, and if you meet the requirements outlined in the job description, you will automatically be considered for the interview.  Your choice to share this information is entirely voluntary and confidential. Your data will not be shared with the hiring manager without your consent.

We remain dedicated to fair and robust interview processes based on standardized criteria to evaluate all applicants objectively. However, we recognize that some individuals may face additional challenges in reaching the initial interview stage, so we have introduced this approach. Our aim is to broaden the diversity of our talent pool, promoting equal opportunities for all.

At NI, diversity and inclusion are at the heart of our values. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and help us build a workplace that embraces diversity, fosters inclusion, and values the strength of our differences
